info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 25 at 4:46PM EST until January 27 at 1:01PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Transylvania and Henderson Counties. .Moderate rainfall over the upper French Broad River watershed has resulted in 1-2 inches of accumulation since Thursday morning. While significant rainfall has departed the area, excessive runoff has caused significant stream rises on tributaries as well the upper French Broad River, resulting in isolated areas of bankfull rises and nuisance flooding of adjacent, low-lying areas. The upper French Broad River from Brevard to Penrose, Blantyre, and Etowah will rise to near 16.0 feet by Friday morning before a slow recession begins. However, additional heavy rainfall is possible on Saturday and given high streamflows and saturated soils, additional rises on the French Broad River and associated tributaries are likely. Residents, business owners, and other interested parties should stay weather aware and monitor the latest forecasts. A River Flood Warning may be issued for Minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Farmland flooding continues on both sides of the French Broad River. Floodwaters begin to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 13.0 feet and rising rapidly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Action/Advisory Stage overnight tonight and crest near Minor Flood Stage or 16.0 feet late Friday morning or early Friday afternoon. A higher crest between 16.0 and 16.5 feet is possible. The river will begin a slow recession Friday afternoon through early Saturday morning. New river rises are possible on Saturday with additional heavy rainfall. A Flood Warning may be necessary. Stay weather aware and monitor the latest forecasts. - Action/Advisory Stage is 15.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before Friday morning at 1130 AM EST.
